setStatusCode.description: Return an instance with the specified status code and, optionally, reason phrase.

getReason.description: Gets the response phrase associated with the status code.

getReasonPhrase.description: Gets the response reason phrase associated with the status code.

setContentType.description: Sets the Content Type header for this response with the mime type and, optionally, the charset.

setJSON.description: Sets the Content Type header for this response with the mime type and, optionally, the charset.

getJSON.description: Returns the current body, converted to JSON is it isn't already.

setXML.description: Converts $body into XML, and sets the correct Content-Type.

noCache.description: Sets the appropriate headers to ensure this response is not cached by the browsers.

setCache.description: A shortcut method that allows the developer to set all of the cache-control headers in one method call.

send.description: Sends the output to the browser.

sendHeaders.description: Sends the headers of this HTTP request to the browser.

sendBody.description: Sends the Body of the message to the browser.

deleteCookie.description: Sets a cookie to be deleted when the response is sent.

redirect.description: Perform a redirect to a new URL, in two flavors: header or location.

download.description: Generates the headers that force a download to happen. And sends the file to the browser.

respond.description: Provides a single, simple method to return an API response, formatted to match the requested format, with proper content-type and status code.

fail.description: Used for generic failures that no custom methods exist for.

respondCreated.description: Used after successfully creating a new resource.

respondDeleted.description: Used after a resource has been successfully deleted.

respondUpdated.description: Used after a resource has been successfully updated.

respondNoContent.description: Used after a command has been successfully executed but there is no meaningful reply to send back to the client.

failUnauthorized.description: Used when the client is either didn't send authorization information, or had bad authorization credentials. User is encouraged to try again with the proper information.

failForbidden.description: Used when access is always denied to this resource and no amount of trying again will help.

failNotFound.description: Used when a specified resource cannot be found.

failValidationError.description: Used when the data provided by the client cannot be validated.

failValidationErrors.description: Used when the data provided by the client cannot be validated on one or more fields.

failResourceExists.description: Use when trying to create a new resource and it already exists.

failResourceGone.description: Use when a resource was previously deleted. This is different than Not Found, because here we know the data previously existed, but is now gone, where Not Found means we simply cannot find any information about it.

failTooManyRequests.description: Used when the user has made too many requests for the resource recently.

failServerError.description: Used when there is a server error.

setResponseFormat.description: Sets the format the response should be in.
